Home > misc > dist > stk_dist.m

stk_dist

PURPOSE

STK_DIST computes a matrix of (Euclidean) distances

SYNOPSIS

function D = stk_dist(x, y, pairwise)

DESCRIPTION 

 STK_DIST computes a matrix of (Euclidean) distances

 CALL: D = stk_dist(X, Y)

    computes the matrix of distances between X and Y. More precisely, if
    X is an nX x d matrix, and Y an nY x d matrix, the D is an nX x nY
    matrix with

       D_{i,j} = norm(X(i,:) - Y(j,:)),

    where norm(.) denotes the Euclidean norm in R^d.

 See also: stk_mindist, norm

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:

0042 function D = stk_dist(x, y, pairwise)
0043 
0044 if nargin > 3,
0045    stk_error ('Too many input arguments.', 'TooManyInputArgs');
0046 end
0047 
0048 % read argument #1
0049 x = double(x);
0050 
0051 % read argument #2
0052 if nargin < 2,
0053     y = [];
0054 else
0055     y = double(y);
0056 end
0057 
0058 % read argument #3
0059 if nargin < 3,
0060     pairwise = false;
0061 else
0062     if ~islogical(pairwise)
0063         errmsg = 'Argument ''pairwise'' should be either true or false.';
0064         stk_error(errmsg, 'TypeMismatch');
0065     end
0066 end
0067 
0068 if pairwise,
0069     if isempty(y),
0070         D = zeros(size(x, 1), 1);
0071     else
0072         D = stk_dist_pairwise(x, y);
0073     end
0074 else
0075     if isempty(y),
0076         D = stk_dist_matrixx(x);
0077     else
0078         D = stk_dist_matrixy(x, y);
0079     end
0080 end
0081 
0082 end % function stk_dist
0083
